author: Attila the Hun
quote: Sacking Rome is fine. The actual sacking part is great. It's the paperwork afterward that really grinds you down.

author: Genghis Khan
quote: I have conquered half the known world from the back of a horse, yet I still cannot get my fitted sheet to stay on the corner of the mattress.

author: Julius Caesar
quote: The key to military strategy is the element of surprise. Which is why I always hide in the kitchen pantry to scare my legionaries when they come in for a snack.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: An army marches on its stomach. Which is incredibly inconvenient, because we keep tripping over each other. It's a logistical nightmare.

author: Julius Caesar
quote: Veni, vidi, wifi. I came, I saw, I asked for the network password.

author: Alexander the Great
quote: I don't want to conquer the world anymore. I just want to sit down in a quiet room and finally finish a Sudoku without someone trying to assassinate me.

author: Julius Caesar
context: reflecting on the Ides of March
quote: People say 'Et tu, Brute?' like it was the ultimate betrayal. Honestly? The real betrayal was when Brute said he'd split an Uber with me and then ‘forgot' his wallet.

author: Hannibal
quote: The hardest part about crossing the Alps with elephants wasn't the cold or the terrain. It was the constant stopping for bathroom breaks. We made terrible time.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: If I had known history would remember me mostly for being short—even though I was average height for the time—I would have worn much taller hats.

author: Cleopatra
quote: Bathing in asses' milk every day sounds glamorous until you realize how much time you have to spend sourcing that many donkeys in the desert. It's a full-time job.

author: Genghis Khan
quote: Listen, I'm just saying, if you're going to build a Great Wall, at least put in a decent drive-thru window every few miles.

author: Niccolò Machiavelli
quote: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both. But it is best of all to be the guy who brought the good donuts to the morning meeting.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies, but not the madness of people who stand in the middle of the escalator instead of walking to the right.

author: Charles Darwin
quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent. It is the one that remembers to cancel the free trial before the credit card gets charged.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: E = mc². Energy equals milk coffee squared. It's the only way I can get any work done in this patent office.

author: Benjamin Franklin
quote: I didn't actually discover electricity. I just rubbed my socks on the carpet and touched a doorknob, and then things got way out of hand.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: We hold these truths to be self-evident: that all men are created equal, except for people who chew with their mouths open. They are evidently worse.

author: Abraham Lincoln
quote: Four score and seven years ago... actually, wait. Does anyone have a charger? My phone is at 4% and I have the rest of the speech on there.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: We shall fight on the beaches, we shall fight on the landing grounds... but we shall not fight on the freeway at 5:00 PM on a Friday. We shall sit in traffic and listen to a podcast.

author: Henry VIII
quote: I have had six wives. You would think at least one of them would have known how to load the dishwasher correctly. Bowls go on the top rack, Anne!

author: Queen Victoria
quote: We are not amused. We are actually just hungry. Does this palace have any snacks?

author: William Shakespeare
quote: To be, or not to be? That is the question. The answer is usually 'not to be,' because I cancelled plans to stay home and watch Netflix in my pajamas.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: I call this masterpiece The Starry Night not because of the celestial beauty, but because I couldn't find my glasses and everything looked kind of blurry.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
quote: Speak softly and carry a big stick. Also, bring a jacket. My mother said it might get chilly later.

author: Werner Heisenberg
quote: I can tell you exactly how fast my car was going, Officer. But according to my calculations, that means I have absolutely no idea where it is right now. So technically, I wasn't even here.

author: J. Robert Oppenheimer
quote: Now I am become Death, the destroyer of worlds. Also, I accidentally put a fork in the microwave again. So, destroyer of appliances, mostly.

author: Marie Curie
quote: The best part about working with radium isn't the scientific breakthrough. It's that I never stub my toe during a midnight bathroom run. I am my own nightlight.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: God does not play dice with the universe. He plays Monopoly. And just like in Monopoly, He refuses to trade me the Boardwalk property even though I offered Him both utilties.

author: Erwin Schrödinger
quote: My cat is dead. My cat is alive. Honestly, until I open the box, the only thing that is certain is that I don't have to clean the litter box yet.

author: Ada Lovelace
quote: I am considered the first computer programmer. Which effectively means I was the first person in history to spend six hours staring at a wall, only to realize I forgot a semicolon on line 4.

author: Alan Turing
quote: I cracked the Enigma code in absolute secrecy to save the free world. But for the life of me, I cannot remember which variation of 'Password123!' I used for my Netflix login.

author: Grace Hopper
quote: It is easier to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission. This is especially true when you have just accidentally dropped the production database tables on a Friday afternoon.

author: Tim Berners-Lee
quote: I envisioned the World Wide Web as a glorious platform for global collaboration and shared human knowledge. I did not anticipate that 90% of it would be videos of cats falling off furniture.

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
context: accidentally attributed to a Junior Developer
quote: I have a dream... that one day, my code will compile without warnings. I have a dream that one day, the documentation will actually match the API.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of giants. And by 'giants,' I mean copying and pasting code from Stack Overflow threads from 2013.

author: Marie Antoinette
quote: Let them eat cake. Or brioche. Or honestly, just whatever is in the back of the pantry. I haven't been grocery shopping in weeks and the carriage has a flat tire.

author: Queen Elizabeth I
quote: I have the heart and stomach of a king, but the neck of a giraffe who slept in a drafty barn. This collar is ruining my posture.

author: Catherine the Great
quote: They say I have a reputation for... adventurous romances. But honestly, I just swipe right on everyone because I'm bored and the winter in Russia is very, very long.

author: Queen Victoria
quote: I am not amusing myself. I am merely trying to get this corset off without dislocating a rib. It is a two-person job, and one of the persons has quit.

author: Amelia Earhart
quote: The most effective way to do it, is to do it. But the second most effective way is to wait until the deadline is 10 minutes away and let the panic fuel you.

author: Louisa May Alcott
quote: I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship. I am, however, terrified of parallel parking. I will circle the block for an hour to avoid it.

author: Joan of Arc
quote: I'm not saying the voices in my head are right, but they did remind me to turn off the oven before I left the house, so who's the real winner here?

author: Florence Nightingale
quote: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took an excuse. Also, I washed my hands. Like, constantly. You people are gross.

author: Jane Austen
quote: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife. But it is also a truth that he probably has a weird laugh and replies to texts with just a 'thumbs up' emoji.

author: Frida Kahlo
context: on the art of the selfie
quote: I paint self-portraits because I am so often alone, because I am the person I know best, and because I can't figure out how to turn the camera around on this stupid phone.

author: Mary Shelley
quote: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful. Also, I haven't had my coffee yet, so don't speak to me until noon.

author: Agatha Christie
quote: The best time to plan a book is while you're doing the dishes. The best time to plan a murder is while you're listening to your neighbor practice the trumpet for the third hour in a row.

author: Gandalf the Grey
quote: A wizard is never late, Frodo. Nor is he early. He arrives precisely when... hang on, I put the wrong address in Waze. I'm at a Starbucks five miles away. Start the fellowship without me.

author: Darth Vader
quote: I find your lack of faith disturbing. I also find the fact that you didn't refill the coffee pot when you took the last cup disturbing. Prepare to die.

author: Captain James T. Kirk
quote: Space: the final frontier. These are the voyages of the Starship Enterprise. Its five-year mission: to find a planet that actually has decent Wi-Fi so I can upload my Captain's Log.

author: Boromir
quote: One does not simply walk into Mordor. You have to book a reservation months in advance, and the parking is a nightmare. Honestly, it's a tourist trap.

author: Princess Leia
context: sending a holographic tech support ticket
quote: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope. I've tried turning the router off and on again, and the blinking light won't stop.

author: Batman
context: on the downsides of the Batsuit
quote: I am Vengeance. I am the Night. I am... really regretting choosing a costume made entirely of non-breathable rubber. It is incredibly humid in here.

author: Sherlock Holmes
quote: Elementary, my dear Watson. I knew the suspect was lying not because of his pulse, but because he used the wrong 'your' in his text message. A criminal mind is often grammatically sloppy.
The name's Bond. James Bond. And I have been trying to reach you about your Aston Martin's extended warranty.

author: Spider-Man
quote: With great power comes great responsibility. And with a spandex suit comes a very specific laundry routine. You can't just throw this thing in the dryer.

author: Indiana Jones
context: on archeological hazards in the kitchen
quote: It belongs in a museum! Along with that casserole in the back of your fridge! It's been there since the Reagan administration!

author: The Wicked Witch of the West
quote: I'll get you, my pretty, and your little dog too! But first, does anyone have an Ibuprofen? My head is killing me. This green face paint smells like chemicals.

author: Count Dracula
quote: Listen, I don't drink... wine. I drink Red Bull. Do you know how hard it is to stay up all night haunting people? I'm exhausted.

author: Rhett Butler
quote: Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn. But if you touch the thermostat, we are going to have a serious problem. I like it at 68 degrees.

author: Dr. Frankenstein
quote: It's alive! IT'S ALIVE! Oh, wait, never mind. I just forgot to unplug the toaster. It's just toast.
